runs.comm: that's quite a start! Ashwin twirls down an offbreak that rushes straight on past Hales's outside edge
Hales gets himself in a bit of a tangle as he rushes down the track, and has to dig out a full delivery
a tip-and-run single to get off the mark! Hales taps to cover and sets off
the carrom ball from Ashwin, but it slips down the leg side
an appeal! Kieswetter bent into a massive slog sweep to another one that went on with the arm, but missed and was hit on the front pad. Too high, by the looks of things
Kieswetter tees off! He's going to look to put the bowlers under pressure as they seek to defend this total. He charges out and slices a drive over wide long off
another big heave from Kieswetter. It's not entirely convincing, but he collects two as the ball bounces out to deep square
there's some turn for him straight away, but he slips onto the pads and is easily picked through square leg
too straight again from Pathan, and Kieswetter glances to short fine leg
tucked off the pads out to deep midwicket. The placement is good enough for them to rush back for the second
was there an inside edge on this? Hales played back, swishing across the line, and was struck on the pad. Possible edge
flicked just wide of midwicket for one
speared down the leg side, Kieswetter gets a glove to the slog sweep and they rush through
bah, that's a horrid delivery. Fired down the leg side, and it's slammed to long leg on the sweep
is this a drop? The ball spun sharply down the leg side, and appeared to flick something on the way through ... either way, Dhoni couldn't hold it
it looks like Hales is reading them off the pitch here. He played back and turns it with the spin into the leg side
flicked down quicker and flatter through the air by Ashwin, and it's defended to leg
tapped to cover point for a quick single
a touch short from the offspinner, but he's not punished as it's pulled straight to square leg
a toe-ended sweep trickles into the leg side, but into space and so that's a run

Kieswetter holes out! He charged down the track but couldn't quite get to the pitch of the delivery, slicing across the line and scooping a swirling chance out into the deep. Massive cheers erupt around Eden Gardens!
Hales telegraphs his intentions to sweep, and ends up looking a little clueless as the ball spins past his swishing bat
nudged to cover point, and the fielder scoots round to stop the single
punched down to that man at long off for one
turn and bounce for Jadeja! Pietersen attempted an extravagant flat-batted drive, and didn't get close. From somewhere behind the wicket, a guttural scream rent the skies of Kolkata. I'm alarmed
clipped with the turn through midwicket
a lofted flamingo-flick gets more height than distance, but falls safely in no-man's land at deep midwicket
wow, this carrom ball really fizzed off the surface. Hales read it well, though, and nudged a single to cover
prodding defence from KP

dropped by Raina! But what an effort. Pietersen top-edged a huge mow into the leg side, three men converged under the ball somewhere near long leg, and Raina was the one to dive for it. Valiant effort, but it bobbles out!
big turn again, this time with the offbreak. Defence from Hales
KP lunges forward to defend to extra cover
turned to midwicket, Hales wonders quite a distance down the track before he's sent back
off the pad to square leg, there's just time for a scampered leg bye
an attempted reverse sweep is utterly fluffed by Hales. He gave away his intentions too soon, allowing Jadeja to react
an appeal! Jadeja turned and screamed at the umpire as soon as this hit pad, but all he gets is a calm shake of the head. It didn't look out
crunched back to the bowler, who fields in his follow through
eased through mid on for one
the dilscoop from KP! He got right across to offstump and ramped this straight over Dhoni's head
much quicker and flatter from Pathan, and Pietersen defends
what a shot. That's just ridiculous. Pietersen switches his hands and stance to become a left-hander and flays a length delivery deep into the crowd beyond deep cover/midwicket. What confidence
and he follows that up with a single, good batting

there goes another one! Hales had struggled against this plethora of spinners, and now he's out, chipping into the deep on the leg side. Rahane was the man at deep midwicket, and he ran in quickly, sliding forward to take the catch
tapped defensively into the off side
Patel is off the mark with a hard-run too, the ball having been worked through cover point
arrowed wide down the leg side, KP calls him through for what one might call a classic redbull run. Tight
a backfoot punch brings a single on the off side
fielding! Patel backed away and slammed a backfoot punch to extra cover but the fielder there - Raina, I believe - tumbled athletically to his left to cut if off
there's an appeal! Not quite sure for what. Patel backed right to leg, and the ball zipped between the batsman and his stumps
another appeal! This one was for lbw. Optimistic
Pietersen works a single to short fine leg, playing with the spin
Patel is surprised by a hint of extra bounce, nudging the ball uppishly to leg
slammed back over his head! Patel skips out to loft an offspinner down the ground
chopped down to short third man for one
boom! KP silences the crowd with a mighty heave over midwicket. Massive
and again! This scything hit never got up too high, but bounced quickly to wide long on
a medium-paced seam-up delivery is flicked through square leg
punched down to long on for one
chipped down the ground, one more to the total
a misfield from the mop-topped Jadeja! He was at midwicket and got down low as the ball was hit to him, but let it slip past him. He hares after it to keep them to two
dispatched into the deep! They're going to take the seamers on. KP stood back and just slammed this into the leg side off the back foot
another boundary, this time with a sweep! Praveen floated down a low full toss, and Pietersen - who had moved right across to the off side - swept it powerfully to long leg
tapped back down the track
huge! This hit over wide long on went so high, it flew up into the night sky and out of the reach of the floodlights
swiped across the line to midwicket
the bouncer from Kumar! It wasn't that pacy but it did the job, whistling past the batsman's grille
another precious dot, the ball being played into the off side
Patel is sent back! He squeezed a very full ball to point and wanted the run, but Pietersen sent him back. A little late, it might be said. A direct hit might've had him
glanced to short fine leg for a single
Patel makes some room but Jadeja follows him, and the clip goes to midwicket
flicked off the toes through square leg, Patel backing to leg once again
Pietersen received this delivery while standing about a foot outside leg, slamming it to extra cover where it was very well stopped by Raina. He's like a cat in the field
swished into the leg side, but he can't beat the field
cracking delivery! It dips, grips and spins on KP, who is hit on the pad. Outside leg though
a very full delivery on off stump is dug out down the ground
short and wide outside off, but KP just has a look and lets it go. Perhaps he thought it would be called wide?
Vinay goes full again, and KP collects a single to a deep-ish mid off
this is a touch too short on this benign pitch, but Patel's slapped pull is stopped at deep midwicket
Pietersen goes into the 40s! He's taking this game away from India. This was another great shot, a drive that threaded the men in the covers and raced away
too short again! Pietersen waited and waited on this slower ball bouncer, and then hammered it over deep midwicket
defended back down the track
pushed to long on. Ashwin tried to get across to cut it off but bumped into Pietersen
a desperate, pleading appeal from the bowler! KP bent down into a reverse sweep, the ball spinning in to hit him on the pad. And what's more, that hit him in line
tapped away for a single
worked through square leg for one
big spin for Ashwin! He rips one in sharply, and finds bounce to to strike KP amidships. No wicket for him then
a sliced drive flies over cover point and out into the deep
nudged down to gully. The fielder's in very quickly, so no run to be had
KP goes to fifty with a push down the ground. Quite possibly a match-winning knock
Patel falls! He tried to slog this over midwicket but sliced underneath the ball, and Tiwary found himself under an easy chance at cover. Is there a twist in this tale?
a punchy drive goes straight to the man at extra cover
slapped hard, on the up, through point. They hurry back for the second
speared down the leg side, a clear wide
turned off the pads for one, KP back on strike
an easy tip-and-run single is taken to cover
dead-batted through point, one more to the total
pushed through flat and fast, and it's chopped to extra cover

he's given him! Pietersen swivelled into a reverse sweep but missed the ball and was struck on the pad. Raina was bowling round the wicket, however, and this looked to have pitched outside leg. But he's got to go, and to his credit he does so without complaining. Is there still hope for India?
pushed defensively back down the track
a square drive is stopped at point, the crowd cheering it's approval
that'll help! Much too short from Kohli, and this ball just sat up and asked to be hit. Bopara did just that, pulling it hard to wide long on
driven straight to mid off, no single on offer
a slow legcutter is pushed defensively to extra cover
Bopara threads a drive through cover, and they're back for two
what's happened here? Bopara played and missed outside off, and the ball popped outside Dhoni's gloves. Yep, it's given as byes, so no bat on it
nudged into space at point, and there's an easy single to be had
a tight single! Bairstow played it down close on the off side, but Bopara called straight away. All the same, they had to hurry!
a big appeal as Bopara is hit on the pad! But not given. This looked far, far closer than the Pietersen dismissal
toe-ended to extra cover
squeezed through point for a couple
flicked to leg, one more taken
turned off the pads into the leg side, a quick single taken
another shovel goes to leg, scores level
pushed to point, straight to the fielder
dabbed to short third man, and finally England win in India!
